clinical_study.brief_title: Expertise-Based Randomized Controlled Trial of Scrotal Versus Inguinal Orchidopexy on Post-operative Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Expertise-Based Randomized Controlled Trial of Scrotal Versus Inguinal (Standard) Orchidopexy on Postoperative Pain: EXPRESSO Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Undescended Testis is the most common congenital abnormality of the genitalia in boys and it is commonly managed by surgical intervention. Evidence in the medical literature to support the superiority of either scrotal or inguinal (standard) orchidopexy is lacking. To determine which technique is superior, this study focuses on the degree of post-operative pain after surgery. Therefore, the objective of this randomized control trial is to determine if scrotal orchidopexy reduces postoperative pain in children diagnosed with undescended testis when compared to standard inguinal orchidopexy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured dosage post-surgery (on average 45 minutes later)
primary_outcome.description: Defined as the number of doses of morphine (standardized dose of 0.2 mg/kg) or Tylenol (15mg/kg) or Ibuprofen (10mg/kg) administered by PACU and SDSU nurses following surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measure at 6 hour intervals post discharge for 48 hours
primary_outcome.description: Defined as number of standardized doses of Tylenol (15 mg/kg) and Ibuprofen (10 mg/kg) administered by parent/guardian at home postâˆ’discharge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measure at patient admission and discharge at 30 minute intervals.
secondary_outcome.description: Pain scores will be measured through a reliable and validated observer-rated Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario Pain Scale (CHEOPS) by two trained, blinded, and independent study personnel. Both study personnel will measure pain at admission and discharge during the recovery phase.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measure at patient admission and discharge at 30 minute intervals.
secondary_outcome.description: Pain scores will be measured through a reliable and validated observer-rated Face, Legs, Activity, Cry, Consolability (FLACC) Behavioural Scale by two trained, blinded, and independent study personnel. Both study personnel will measure pain at admission and discharge during the recovery phase.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measure at 6 hour intervals post discharge for 48 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed through validated and reliable Parents Postoperative Pain Measure (PPPM) by trained and blinded parent/guardian at 6, 12,18, 24, 30, 36, 42, 48 hrs post-discharge

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured dosage at the beginning of surgery and post-surgery (on average 45minutes later)
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of pain medication administered to patient intra and post operatively

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Record duration of operative time (takes on average 30-45 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: Obtained from operative case notes. Defined as beginning of first skin incision and ending when post-operative dressing has been applied.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of time from being admitted for surgery until time discharged (which is on average 4 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as duration of time from entering PACU to discharge from day-surgery unit. Recording by study nurse on discharge sheet.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at 48 hour follow-up clinic visit
secondary_outcome.description: Examples include surgical site infection, scrotal hematoma, bleeding, scrotal swelling and wound dehiscence

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at 3 and 6 month follow-up clinic visit
secondary_outcome.description: Examples include: hernia formation and testicular atrophy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at 3 month followup clinic visit
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate in this study is defined by the number of viable testicles successfully positioned into the lower part of the scrotum.
